question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [YAML injection] Can malicious YAML be crafted to deserialize parser_task_count/parser_batch_size as negative values that wrap around to large positive u16 values, bypassing intended limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Type confusion] Can the serde deserializer be tricked into accepting string values for numeric fields (parser_task_count, parser_batch_size) that get parsed unsafely, causing panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Concurrent modification] If IndexerTableInfoConfig is cloned and modified concurrently (as it implements Clone), can this cause data races where different components see inconsistent parser_task_count/parser_batch_size values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [TOCTOU attack] Between the time table_info_service_mode.is_enabled() is checked (runtime.rs:58-62) and when the service starts, can the mode be changed, causing the service to operate in an unintended mode? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Clone safety] Since TableInfoServiceMode contains String values (bucket names) and implements Clone, can concurrent clones cause use-after-free or double-free if one clone is dropped while another is in use? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Hot reload race] If config hot-reload is supported, can parser_task_count/parser_batch_size be modified while get_batches() is executing, causing iteration over inconsistent values and skipped transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Backup] [Backup corruption] Can Backup mode be enabled with an invalid/malicious bucket name causing backup operations to fail silently, leaving no backups and creating a false sense of data protection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Restore] [Restore from malicious source] In Restore mode, is the source bucket authenticated and verified, or can an attacker specify a bucket containing malicious snapshots that corrupt node state when restored? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Restore] [Chain ID mismatch] Does Restore mode verify that restored snapshots match the current chain_id before applying them, or can snapshots from testnet be restored to mainnet causing catastrophic state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Mixed mode attack] Can both Backup and Restore modes be active simultaneously through config race conditions, causing the service to simultaneously upload and download snapshots, leading to data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode::Backup] [Bucket permission bypass] Can an attacker specify a publicly writable GCS bucket in Backup mode, allowing them to upload malicious snapshots that later get restored by honest nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Transaction gap creation] Can mismatched parser_batch_size and parser_task_count values create gaps in processed transaction versions in get_batches() logic (table_info_service.rs:360-390), causing missing table info entries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Duplicate processing] Can parser_batch_size values that don't evenly divide transaction ranges cause overlapping batches where the same transaction gets processed multiple times, leading to duplicate table info entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Epoch boundary bug] When epoch transitions occur, can parser_batch_size cause batches to span epoch boundaries incorrectly in transactions_in_epochs() (table_info_service.rs:613-677), leading to snapshot timing errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Version ordering violation] Can high parser_task_count values cause parallel fetch_batches() calls to return transactions out of order, violating the version ordering check (table_info_service.rs:227-235) and causing processing failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Pending_on accumulation] Can parser_batch_size be tuned to cause excessive pending_on items in parallel processing (table_info_service.rs:286-294), forcing sequential retry that degrades performance or causes timeouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Config sanitizer bypass] Does the IndexerGrpcConfig sanitizer (indexer_grpc_config.rs:93-103) properly validate IndexerTableInfoConfig values, or can invalid configs bypass sanitization and crash the node? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Storage dependency] If storage.enable_indexer is false but table_info_service_mode is enabled, can this create inconsistent state where table info is indexed but not properly stored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Runtime initialization race] Between IndexerTableInfoConfig deserialization and TableInfoService::new() call (runtime.rs:100-107), can parser_task_count/parser_batch_size be modified, causing mismatched initialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [GCS credential timing] If GCS credentials expire or are revoked during backup operations, can the bucket name string persist in memory exposing sensitive bucket paths in crash dumps? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Config file tampering] If the config file is modified by an attacker with file system access, can they set parser_task_count=1 and parser_batch_size=1 to drastically slow down indexing and cause nodes to fall behind? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Const: DEFAULT_PARSER_TASK_COUNT] [Default value DoS] Is the default of 20 concurrent tasks safe for all deployment scenarios, or can it cause resource exhaustion on nodes with limited CPU cores? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Const: DEFAULT_PARSER_BATCH_SIZE] [Default batch size] Is the default batch size of 1000 transactions tested for worst-case memory usage, or can processing 1000 large transactions simultaneously cause OOM crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Trait: Default] [Default mode security] Is TableInfoServiceMode::Disabled the correct secure default, or should nodes require explicit opt-in to enable indexing to prevent unintended resource usage? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Const: DEFAULT_TABLE_INFO_BUCKET] [Orphaned constant] Why is DEFAULT_TABLE_INFO_BUCKET defined but never used - could this indicate missing default bucket initialization logic that leaves backups disabled? (Low)
